field.label: Here's why I'll be great for this gig

confirmation.message: Thank you for expressing interest in this project. You will be contacted by Booktrope staff or a team member soon.
confirmation.name: Default Confirmation

form.title: 1.3 Project Revenue Allocation
form.description:
After you submit a target date for editing completion, please prepare the team agreement using the following values. If all team members are not yet determined, you can indicate "NA" in order to trigger the start of a creative team agreement., but you will need to resubmit this form when all team roles have been filled.

Note: The values submitted must be reviewed and approved by Booktrope Management before legal agreements will be drawn up.

field.description: Enter the percentage of revenue to be credited to the book author(s). This is typically 33%. Use numbers only in the field.
field.label: Author Percentage

field.description: Enter the percentage of revenue to be credited to the book manager. This is typically 24%. Use numbers only in the field.
field.label: Book Manager Percentage

field.description: Enter the percentage of revenue to be credited to the project manager. This is typically 4%. Use numbers only in the field.
field.label: Project Manager Percentage

field.description: Enter the percentage of revenue to be credited to the book editor. This is typically 7%. Use numbers only in the field.
field.label: Editor Percentage

field.description: If you have not been matched with an editor yet, please type "TBC". You will need to resubmit the form when a designer joins your team.
field.label: Designer

field.description: Enter the percentage of revenue to be credited to the book designers(s). This is typically 4%. Use numbers only.
field.label: Designer Percentage

field.description: If you have not been matched with a proofreader yet, please type "TBC". You will need to resubmit the form when a proofreader joins your team.
field.label: Proofreader

field.description: Enter the percentage of revenue to be credited to the book proofreader. This is typically 2%. Use numbers only in the field.
field.label: Proofreader Percentage

field.description: This is typically zero (0%) unless special considerations have been made for your project. Use numbers only in the field.
field.label: Revenue Percentage for Other

field.description: Indicate the legal name of the person to receive the "Other" revenue.
field.label: Recipient of "Other" allocation

field.description: Indicate the reason this project has "Other" revenue.
field.label: Reason for "Other" allocation

field.description: This value must be 70 to submit the form
field.label: Total Percentage Allocated
field.calculationFormula: {Author Percentage: :10} + {Book Manager Percentage::11} + {Editor Percentage:18} + {Designer Percentage: :13} + {Proofreader Percentage: :16} + {Revenue Percentage for Other::12} +{Project Manager Percentage:37}

field.description: The date you would like this allocation agreement to take effect.
field.label: Effective Date
Is this the first time you are submitting a revenue allocation for this project?

rule.value: No

field.description: If your team has submitted an allocation in the past, please indicate the reason for this change.
field.label: Allocation Change Reason:

rule.value: No

field.description: We want to know what genre you think it is, not what we think it is. This helps us determine if the author’s intended genre came through clearly or not. Genre/reader mismatch is one of the key reasons we see negative reviews, so we would like to avoid that scenario whenever possible, right from the start!
field.label: Genre

rule.value: Other

field.label: Is the book typical of the genre?

rule.value: I don't Know

field.label: Are there (popular) authors or books that you would compare this to?

rule.value: Yes

field.label: Did you read the whole book?
If not, how far; why did you stop?

rule.value: No

field.label: Approximately how long did it take you to read the book (hours)?
Did the book keep you engaged?

rule.value: No

field.label: Were there parts that dragged or lost you?

rule.value: Yes

field.label: What (if anything) was memorable about the book?
What is your opinion of the title?

choice.text: Got it, but only after reading the book
Liked it, but don’t love it

field.label: What was the first thing you remember that made you keep reading?

rule.value: Yes

field.label: Did the book grab you later, or not at all?

rule.value: No

field.label: Were you satisfied with the ending?
Did you think the book was the right length?
If not, please explain. Was it just too long, or do you think it should be more than one book?

rule.value: No

field.label: Was there anything about the book that confused you?
Did you note any significant flaws in the book?
What did you especially like about the book?
In your opinion, does this book require:

choice.text: Developmental or Story-edit – You would choose this if the book attracted you, but had significant issues in structure. Note that the overall writing quality would need to be sound, but perhaps the flow of the story needs improvement; certain sections need more detail, etc. For example, the book is currently designed with many flashback sequences, and you feel it would be significantly improved by telling the story in a chronological way. Or, you feel as though the book has merit, but is significantly longer than necessary, perhaps should even be more than one book. This may also be your choice if you did not care for the book. In that event, any feedback you can offer to the author (anonymously) may be helpful regardless of our decision to publish or not.

Serious Copy-edit – You would choose this if you feel that the story itself is sound, as is the structure, but there are significant grammatical, or functional issues i.e. a section changes from first person to third on occasion, or the book needs significant spelling or other functional changes.
Light Copy-edit – You would choose this option if the book has consistent grammar, spelling and typo issues – but no full sections you would imagine needing a rewrite.
Proofreading only – You would choose this option if there were only a few spelling or typographical issues, but the overall grammar is sound.

field.label: Developmental or Story-edit: What would you change?

rule.value: Developmental or Story-edit – You would choose this if the book attracted you, but had significant issues in structure. Note that the overall writing quality would need to be sound, but perhaps the flow of the story needs improvement; certain sections need more detail, etc. For example, the book is currently designed with many flashback sequences, and you feel it would be significantly improved by telling the story in a chronological way. Or, you feel as though the book has merit, but is significantly longer than necessary, perhaps should even be more than one book. This may also be your choice if you did not care for the book. In that event, any feedback you can offer to the author (anonymously) may be helpful regardless of our decision to publish or not.

field.label: Do you have any suggestions how the book might be improved?

field.description: In this section, we will ask you to rate the book from 1-5, with 5 being your strongest agreement or support, 1 being the worst. Imagine offering this information to a friend or colleague in an effort to help them decide whether or not they should read the book.
field.label: Ratings Section
How valuable did you find it – i.e. did it supply information or insights, etc.?
How strongly would you recommend the book to a friend?
How likely would you be to purchase this book as a gift?
How likely would you be to purchase another book by this author?
Would you have left a positive review for this book on Amazon or Goodreads?

rule.value: No

field.label: Would you have left a negative review for this book on Amazon or Goodreads?

rule.value: Yes

field.label: If it were up to you, would you publish this book?
Any details you would like to share about this decision?
Is there anything else you would like to tell us about this manuscript?

form.title: 1.2 1099 Form Info
form.description: Please provide us with the following information so that we can properly credit your earnings. You only need to submit this form once - if you have already done so for another book or project, please do not resubmit.

field.description: Some users have noticed a problem. On some browsers, when the form is submitted it just 'sits there' and you get no indication of success. I'm adding an email to let you know we received the information. So, if you submit the form without errors and don't see the thank you page, please check your email before submitting again. Sorry for the inconvenience. - Andy
field.label: Notice
Is this the first time you are submitting the form, or is this a change in information?

choice.text: First time I'm submitting the form
I've already submittted a form in the past. This is an update to my information.

field.description: Please fill out only one. Either SSN or Business name and EIN.

notification.name: User Notification

form.title: 3.5 Publication Fact Sheet (PFS)
form.description: This is it! Please submit this form one time only once all information is complete and FINAL. We will use this information and the files to set up and complete your book. Once submitted, the information and image cannot be revised or updated without incurring a change fee.

field.description: This is the final agreed upon official book title.
field.label: Final Title

field.description: It must have an appealing and informative back cover. The material on the back cover is frequently used elsewhere, such as for your Amazon and Barnes & Noble .com descriptions. It needs to give someone a desire to read your book, pure and simple. Also, be sure to consider relevant keywords for SEO - popular words people search for on Google/Amazon to find books like this. Relevant cities, genres, topics. You can use the Google Key Word tool to see how popular search terms are. Bottom line - the book back should be another invitation to read - like the cover design - and convey the appropriate flavor of the book!
field.label: Back Blurb / Book Description

field.description: Be sure to include: author name, writing experience, and any work experience that pertains to the book (like if you wrote a diet book and you’re a certified nutritionist). Also, always include where they can find more information about the author (website URL).
field.label: Author Bio

field.description: Short blurb for inclusion in "Other Great Reads" at the back of similar books. Short blurb for inclusion in “Other Great Reads” at the back of similar Booktrope books - This is a short catchy phrase to communicate the flavor of the book. We include it at the end of other, similar books. Here is an example: Riversong by Tess Hardwick (Contemporary Romance) Sometimes we must face our deepest fears to find hope again. A redemptive story of forgiveness and friendship.
field.label: One line blurb

field.description: In US dollars
field.label: Print Price

field.description: In US dollars. Fiction ebooks are recommended to be priced between $2.99 - $4.99. For exceptions, please talk to your book manager team leader.
field.label: ebook Price

field.description: Please place BISAC Codes here (include description, not only number). If Juvenile, please specify a grade level (e.g. eighth, ninth, twelfth, college freshman...). Enter 3 Codes in order of priority. Use this link for reference: Code List
field.label: Classification and Search Terms

field.description:
Separate terms by commas. These are popular terms, or keywords, about your book that readers would use to search for a book of this nature on Amazon. The search terms help SEO so your book appears to new readers!

Please read Amazon's guidelines on Search Terms here. You cannot use anything misrepresentative, such as the name of an author that is not associated with your book. https://kdp.amazon.com/self-publishing/help?topicId=A2EZES9JAJ6H02
field.label: Search Terms (up to 7, separate by commas)
What age range is most appropriate for your book?
Do you want your paperback cover to be matte or glossy?

form.title: 2.1 Submit Edited Manuscript
form.description:
Once the editing process is complete, Author must upload your final manuscript for proofreading here. You are only allowed to submit once, so please ensure editing is final! (.doc or .docx only)

Please note the special formatting requirements required for uploading in step 2.2.

field.description: .doc or .docx file only
field.label: Final Manuscript

field.description: To ensure no confusion when edited documents are exchanged multiple times between the author and editor, we strongly encourage both the author and editor to review the final document prior to submission.
field.label: Version Control

choice.text: The editor has reviewed the document I am attaching - prior to my upload - and confirmed that this is the correct, edited version.

rule.value: Do not proofread the manuscript

field.description: Please note that the above items will increase the time required to produce your book.

choice.text: My book has illustrations or images inserted throughout

notification.name: User Notification

form.title: 2.6 Approve Final Document
form.description: Once the layout is complete, Booktrope will upload your final laid out document here. It will appear below in the list. Please be sure you are downloading the PDF in Adobe (not viewing it in an internet browser).

field.description:
Please download and use the Team Review Checklist and Change Request Form (Final Manuscript PDF) to review the manuscript and communicate any changes that may be needed. Please note that the first page of this spreadsheet contains the Review Checklist and the second contains the Print Change Request Form.

If you do not approve and changes are requested, the Booktrope Production Team will make your changes and re-upload here for your approval when complete.

You are only allowed to give approval once, so please ensure editing is final! After you acknowledge that you approve the manuscript, the ownership of manuscript layout transfers to the Booktrope Production Team. Any last minute changes must be submitted to the Booktrope Production Team and may incur additional charges.

Note, if your book has an index, you are responsible for providing the Booktrope Production Team a revised index with updated page references per the approved layout. Please download the Index Template and use this file to update provide the Booktrope Production Team your revised index below.
field.label: Instructions:

field.description: If the team wants to discuss changes together, please do this in advance in your teamroom. You may only submit one change request spreadsheet per team. If multiple forms are submitted, only the first one will be considered. If you request inclusion of further changes from additional forms, you will incur a fee.
field.label: Author's Final Proof Authorization

choice.text: The team has reviewed the final proofed document attached and we approve all aspects of the work for publication exactly as submitted.
Not approved. See change request spreadsheet attached
I don't have a book manager

rule.value: The team has reviewed the final proofed document attached and we approve all aspects of the work for publication exactly as submitted.

field.label: Does this book have an index?

choice.text: Yes, and I have updated the index page references according to the approved layout in the attached document.

rule.value: The team has reviewed the final proofed document attached and we approve all aspects of the work for publication exactly as submitted.
Yes, and I have updated the index page references according to the approved layout in the attached document.

field.description: .xls or .xlsx file only.
field.label: Checklist/Issues File

rule.value: Not approved. See change request spreadsheet attached

field.description: For andy use only. Please leave as is.
field.label: Project Info

form.title: 3.4 eBook Final Review
form.description:
Once ebooks are ready, Booktrope will upload the Nook (epub) and Kindle (mobi) files and they will show up below for your review. You will need to download the ebook files and review them either using your own device or by downloading the free desktop apps available for Nook and Kindle.

Once you check the box below and submit the form, your book will be released for sale.

Please download and use the Team Review Checklist and Change Request Form (ebooks) to review the eBooks and communicate any changes that may be needed. Please note that the first page of this spreadsheet contains the Review Checklist and the second contains the eBook Change Request Form.

choice.text: Yes, the attached documents meet my approval. The ebooks are ready for print publication.
No, issues are described in the attached Change Request spreadsheet.

rule.value: No, issues are described in the attached Change Request spreadsheet.

form.title: 2.0 Editing Complete Date
form.description: The team commits to completing the editing process by the date entered below. This step must be completed as soon as possible after the editor and author agree to work together. We will not issue a creative team agreement until this step is complete.

field.description: Please enter the date that the team commits to completing the final edit.
field.label: Editing Complete Committed Date

notification.name: Admin Notification

notification.subject: {form_title} from {Submitted by:5} for {Book Project (Working Title):3}
notification.message:
Thank you for setting the edit complete date. We will set up project milestone dates and schedule staff based on these dates. Please note that we anticipate your manuscript will require an additional two weeks for proofreading and a month for production, assuming your team responds promptly to the Booktrope production team's requests and review requirements.
Please now go immediately to Step 1. Team Formation and complete the Revenue Split tab for the Author and Editor share you have agreed. If you do not yet have a book manager or designer, please enter "NA" in these fields. This is required before your creative team agreement can be started.
- Booktrope

rule.value: Yes

field.description: According to the copyright office, you can use either but we generally recommend you use your legal name, unless you want to remain completely anonymous – then we can go with your pen name.

field.description:
*Please note: Your marketing release date is NOT the same as the date your publication date. Each sales channel and format (Amazon, Barnes and Noble, etc) has a different review process and can take anywhere from 1 day - 2 weeks before it's available for sale.

For planning purposes, from the point you have approved the layout and submitted your cover templates and publication fact sheet, you can expect your book to be available in approximately 3-4 weeks.
field.label: Planned Marketing Release Date*

form.title: 4.2 Print Corner
form.description:
Please wait until your book is available for sale on Amazon or Barnes and Noble before placing your order.

PLEASE NOTE WE CANNOT SHIP TO PO BOXES. YOU MUST PROVIDE A PHYSICAL ADDRESS OR YOUR ORDER WILL BE REJECTED.

field.description:
For more information on print copies, please visit our policy here: https://teamtrope.com/docs/booktrope-policy-author-copies/

PLEASE NOTE: RETURNS ARE NOT ALLOWED ON ANY TYPE OF ORDER FROM BOOKTROPE
field.label: I'm ready to order print copies of my books!

choice.text: I want to order author copies.
I want to order copies as a creative team member.
I want to order copies for marketing purposes.
I have a bulk order to a 3rd party that exceeds 25 copies.

field.description: Authors please note: If you've already received 100 copies in total, you will be invoiced at 50% off list price.
field.label: Author Copies

choice.text: This is my first order. I understand the first 10 are complimentary, next 15 treated as an advance on royalties
I want to order additional author copies beyond my allotted 25. I understand that I will be invoiced for these copies at cost up to 100 books.
I've already received 125 copies. I understand I will be invoiced at 50% off list price for all add'l copies.

rule.value: I want to order author copies.

field.description:
I understand I will be billed via Paypal per the terms specified in the Print Books found here: https://teamtrope.com/docs/booktrope-policy-author-copies/

Payment is due immediately upon receipt of the bill. Failure to pay this bill in a timely manner will result in suspension of my ability to order print copies directly from Booktrope in the future.
field.label: Billing Acceptance

choice.text: By checking the box, I am stating I agree to the terms below.

rule.value: I want to order author copies.
I want to order copies as a creative team member.

field.description: Our standard is to provide 25 copies as an author advance (the first 10 are complimentary).
field.label: Quantity for Author Orders

rule.value: I want to order author copies.

field.description: Please note you will be invoiced at 50% off list price. You must order a minimum of 10 copies.
field.label: Quantity for Creative Team Member

rule.value: I want to order copies as a creative team member.

field.label: Before you can order copies for marketing purposes, the following items must be completed:

choice.text: I (or the author I am ordering for) have an author profile filled out in my teamroom
I have a marketing plan that I am contributing to in my teamroom and I've provided a link to it below.

rule.value: I want to order copies for marketing purposes.

field.description: Please include a hyperlink to your active marketing plan in your teamroom in order to receive book copies for marketing purposes.
field.label: Link to Marketing Plan

rule.value: I have a marketing plan that I am contributing to in my teamroom and I've provided a link to it below.

field.description: We allow 5 print copies (and unlimited ebooks) to be used for marketing purposes. This includes high profile book bloggers, contest awards, etc. If you require more, please explain why below.
field.label: Quantity to be shipped for Marketing Purposes

rule.value: I (or the author I am ordering for) have an author profile filled out in my teamroom
I have a marketing plan that I am contributing to in my teamroom and I've provided a link to it below.

field.description: We will only ship print copies within the United States.
field.label: Shipping Address for Marketing Copies

rule.value: I (or the author I am ordering for) have an author profile filled out in my teamroom

50 and over, 30% discount off list price
100 and over, 40% discount off list price
250 and over, 50% discount off list price
Greater than 500 (Booktrope will contact you to discuss price)

form.title: 4.4 Free/Price Promo
form.description: For more information how to schedule and effectively and execute a free book campaign, check out this document: https://teamtrope.com/wp-admin/post.php?post=5016&action=edit&message=6

field.description:
*PLEASE NOTE* We are discontinuing the use of KDP Select promotions until further notice. If you would like to make a book free, please use our force free method below.

If you choose an iTunes/Force Free promotion, there is NO guarantee your book will go free on Amazon. Please do not commit to any promotional spend or ads until Amazon has actually made your book free.

PLEASE REVIEW THE FREE BOOK PROMOTION GUIDELINES BEFORE PROCEEDING: https://teamtrope.com/docs/free-book-promotions-2/
field.label: Please select the type of promotion you'd like to schedule
If you aren't able to provide at least a weeks notice for the price change, please explain why. We will contact you if we are able to meet your request in this short timeframe.

field.description: Please provide the date you want us to make your book free on iTunes. No there is no guarantee when, if ever, Amazon will match the free price.
field.label: Force Free Dates

rule.value: iTunes/Force free promotion

field.description: Please let us know what price you would like your ebook discounted to.
field.label: Price promotion

rule.value: Price promotion

field.description: Please provide the date you would like your promotion to be in effect by. Note it can take up to 48 hours for a price change to take effect, and it requires a manual effort by our team. Please submit your request at least 5 days in advance to ensure we have time to make the change. It is likely the change will be implemented a few days in advance.
field.label: Price Promotion Start Date

rule.value: Price promotion

field.description: Please provide the date you would like your promotion to be in effect by. Note it can take up to 48 hours for a price change to take effect, and it requires a manual effort by our team. If you do not see your price change implemented and it has been at least 48 hours after the date you requested, please contact a Booktrope staff member.
field.label: Price Promotion End Date

rule.value: Price promotion

field.description:
If you're doing a $0.99 promotion, we strongly encourage you to submit to these sites to help let readers know about the deal. Don't forget to spread the word on social media as well!
*Booktrope will pay this expense and treat it as a marketing expense shared across the team. Please use the following paypal address accounting@booktrope.com.
field.label: Get the word out about your $0.99 price promotions and contact the sites below

choice.text: Pixel of Ink (free ad placement if selected) - http://www.pixelofink.com/sskb/
Ereader News Today (they charge a fee based on % of sales through their website.*) - http://ereadernewstoday.com/bargain-kindle-books/
Bargain Booksy (only submit for free editorial consideration, not the $50 guarantee) - http://bargainbooksy.com/for-authors/

rule.value: Price promotion

form.title: 2.2 Submit Final Proofed Document
form.description: The Author must upload your final manuscript after proofreading here. This is your LAST CHANCE to submit corrections for typos or any other proofreading errors. You are only allowed to submit once, so please ensure editing is final! (.doc or .docx only)

rule.value: Content text has been converted to palatino linotype, size 10
All text is fully justified (text is aligned with both the left and right margin)
All editing and stylistic choices (italics, caps) have been made and are final
All chapter headings are size 14 font and there is a page break inserted between each chapter

field.description: Preparing your document with the above items will ensure layout is completely accurately and timely.
field.label: Are you ready to upload your proofread manuscript for layout?

choice.text: Content text has been converted to palatino linotype, size 10
Any Acknowledgments, Dedication, Author Notes, etc. that I want included are included in this manuscript
Any and all tracked changes have been accepted or rejected; Comments have been removed
All text is fully justified (text is aligned with both the left and right margin)

Chapter Headings are the way I want them to appear in the final manuscript (e.g. "Chapter One," "Chapter 1", "1", "CHAPTER ONE"). Also, I have reviewed and made sure that Chapter Numbering is correct (No missing or duplicated numbers).
All editing and stylistic choices (italics, caps) have been made and are final
All chapter headings are size 14 font and there is a page break inserted between each chapter
I have looked over and approved the proofreading and the content. Nothing more will be added or removed from this document, and no further changes will be made.

field.description:
Checking this box will instruct us to add a scene change indicator (a line or other graphic mark at the layout artist's discretion) to separate scenes in the book.
Note: If you prefer your breaks to appear as blank space in the final book, please leave this unchecked and note as much in the "text needing special treatment" field below.
field.label: Scene Changes

choice.text: All narrative breaks/scene changes are indicated with three asterisks (***).
choice.value: breaks are shown as three asterisks (***)

choice.text: Yes, and all sub-section are indicated by increments of increasing size by +4pt (i.e. 14 pt for smallest subsections, 18 pt for sections above that, 22 pt for ones above that, etc.)

field.label: Does your manuscript have images within the content?

choice.text: Yes ‐I have pictures and they are already inserted in the manuscript at the highest resolution possible (at least 300 dpi) in location and size desired
Yes -I have pictures and I've provided a link to a dropbox containing all the pictures & an excel document indicating where each one should go & how big they should be

rule.value: Content text has been converted to palatino linotype, size 10
All text is fully justified (text is aligned with both the left and right margin)
All editing and stylistic choices (italics, caps) are locked in before submission
All chapter headings are size 14 font and there is a page break inserted between each chapter
All section breaks are indicated with asterisks*

field.label: Link to Dropbox file containing images to be inserted in manuscript

rule.value: Yes -I have pictures and I've provided a link to a dropbox containing all the pictures & an excel document indicating where each one should go & how big they should be

field.label: Excel file containing information for where images should go in manuscript

rule.value: Yes -I have pictures and I've provided a link to a dropbox containing all the pictures & an excel document indicating where each one should go & how big they should be

field.description: Note - most special content treatment (italics, bold) should be implemented prior to submission for layout.
field.label: I have sections of text needing special treatment (optional)

field.description: In Word: Go to File, Properties, click on the Statistics tab and enter the "Words:" count value. This will help us estimate and schedule your layout resource efficiently.
field.label: Manuscript Word Count

field.description: You must provide the year AND publisher if your book was previously published. Layout cannot start until this is provided.
field.label: Year and Publisher

field.description: .doc or .docx file only
field.label: Final Manuscript

rule.value: Content text has been converted to palatino linotype, size 10
All text is fully justified (text is aligned with both the left and right margin)
All editing and stylistic choices (italics, caps) have been made and are final
All chapter headings are size 14 font and there is a page break inserted between each chapter

field.description: <b>IMPORTANT: Assuming no unusual complications, at this point you should expect for it to take approximately 4 weeks for your books to be finalized, and an additional 2 weeks for standard shipping time. <b> Please note that while we will do everything we can to work with you to meet this date, we have a queue of manuscripts going through our system at all times. Deadlines are also dependent on the creative team providing necessary feedback and deliverables (including cover templates and publication fact sheet) within two days of layout being approved.
field.label: Are you planning a launch party or other event for which you need books on hand by a specfiic date?
